DataElement.preferredName: Abdomen and Thoracic Visceral Organs Soft Tissue Sarcoma AJCC Edition 8 Pathologic Distant Metastasis M Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the distant metastasis for soft tissue sarcoma of the trunk and extremities based on clinical stage information combined with operative findings, and evidence obtained from pathology review when surgery is the first definitive therapy, using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Abdomen And Thoracic Visceral Organs Soft Tissue Sarcoma Pathologic M Category
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The portion of the body that lies between the thorax and the pelvis._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._Having to do with the chest._Of, or relating to, or affecting the internal organs._A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus._A malignant neoplasm arising from muscle tissue, adipose tissue, blood vessels, fibrous tissue, or other supportive tissues excluding the bones._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

Concepts.definition: The cavity located between the lungs and pelvis. It contains the lower esophagus, stomach, pancreas, intestines, liver, gallbladder and spleen.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Having to do with the chest.
Of, or relating to, or affecting the internal organs.

A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.
A malignant neoplasm arising from muscle tissue, adipose tissue, blood vessels, fibrous tissue, or other supportive tissues excluding the bones.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: TL released; 2/24/22.  4-4-19 created for AJCC Ed. 8; tmt.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma Abdomen and Thoracic Visceral Organs American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 M Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of soft tissue sarcoma of the abdomen and thoracic visceral organs, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This classification system does not apply to desmoplastic small round cell tumor, epithelioid hemangioendothelioma, inflammatory myofibroblastic tumor, perivascular epithelioid cell tumor (PEComa), solitary fibrous tumor, gastrointestinal stromal tumor (GIST), uterine leiomyosarcoma, and retroperitoneal leiomyosarcoma.  This is a new classification system and there is no recommended prognostic stage grouping at this time. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
